description:
Create a cifti dense timeseries.

All input files must have the same number of columns/subvolumes.  Only the specified components will be in the output cifti.  At least one component must be specified.

See -volume-label-import and -volume-help for format details of label volume files.  The structure-label-volume should have some of the label names from this list, all other label names will be ignored:

CORTEX_LEFT
CORTEX_RIGHT
CEREBELLUM
ACCUMBENS_LEFT
ACCUMBENS_RIGHT
ALL_GREY_MATTER
ALL_WHITE_MATTER
AMYGDALA_LEFT
AMYGDALA_RIGHT
BRAIN_STEM
CAUDATE_LEFT
CAUDATE_RIGHT
CEREBELLAR_WHITE_MATTER_LEFT
CEREBELLAR_WHITE_MATTER_RIGHT
CEREBELLUM_LEFT
CEREBELLUM_RIGHT
CEREBRAL_WHITE_MATTER_LEFT
CEREBRAL_WHITE_MATTER_RIGHT
CORTEX
DIENCEPHALON_VENTRAL_LEFT
DIENCEPHALON_VENTRAL_RIGHT
HIPPOCAMPUS_LEFT
HIPPOCAMPUS_RIGHT
INVALID
OTHER
OTHER_GREY_MATTER
OTHER_WHITE_MATTER
PALLIDUM_LEFT
PALLIDUM_RIGHT
PUTAMEN_LEFT
PUTAMEN_RIGHT
THALAMUS_LEFT
THALAMUS_RIGHT

The -unit option accepts these values:

SECOND
HERTZ
METER
RADIAN

volume_data.title: volume_data
volume_data.description: volume file containing all voxel data for all volume structures

structure_label_volume.title: structure_label_volume
structure_label_volume.description: label volume file containing labels for cifti structures

opt_roi_left_roi_metric.title: opt_roi_left_roi_metric
opt_roi_left_roi_metric.description: roi of vertices to use from left surface: the ROI as a metric file

opt_roi_right_roi_metric.title: opt_roi_right_roi_metric
opt_roi_right_roi_metric.description: roi of vertices to use from right surface: the ROI as a metric file

opt_roi_cerebellum_roi_metric.title: opt_roi_cerebellum_roi_metric
opt_roi_cerebellum_roi_metric.description: roi of vertices to use from right surface: the ROI as a metric file

opt_timestep_interval.title: opt_timestep_interval
opt_timestep_interval.description: set the timestep: the timestep, in seconds (default 1.0)

opt_timestart_start.title: opt_timestart_start
opt_timestart_start.description: set the start time: the time at the first frame, in seconds (default 0.0)

opt_unit_unit.title: opt_unit_unit
opt_unit_unit.description: use a unit other than time: unit identifier (default SECOND)
